betterquesting:10.desc:8:
Welcome, Engineer! You hold in your hands the EnergyCraft Guidebook. This book will guide you from humble beginnings to mastering the very fabric of reality itself.

Your journey begins here, in the Stone Age. Master the basics of survival before you can dream of harnessing the power of atoms and dragons.

Click the checkmark below to claim your reward!

Every great engineer started somewhere. For you, that somewhere is punching trees.

Gather some wood to begin crafting your first tools. Any type of log will do!

Wood tools break too quickly. Upgrade to stone!

Craft a stone pickaxe to mine faster and access stronger materials like iron and coal.

Time to go underground! Mine some cobblestone to build with.

Pro tip: Press F3 to see your coordinates. Ores spawn more frequently below Y=64.

Monsters come out at night! Build a shelter and craft a bed to skip the darkness.

A bed also sets your spawn point - very important for an engineer working with dangerous machinery later!

A hungry engineer is a dead engineer. Set up a sustainable food source!

Wheat is reliable, but later you'll discover machines that can automate farming entirely.

Iron is the backbone of industry. You'll need LOTS of it for machines, tools, and infrastructure.

Smelt iron ore in a furnace to get iron ingots. Later, you'll learn to DOUBLE your ore output with machines!

Diamonds are found deep underground, below Y=16. They're essential for advanced tools and will be needed for many machines.

Bring a water bucket - lava is common at diamond level!

The Nether holds valuable resources: Glowstone for lighting, Quartz for circuits, and rare ores.

Build a Nether Portal (4x5 obsidian frame) and light it with flint and steel. Be careful - it's dangerous!

betterquesting:10.name:8: ERA I COMPLETE: The Age of Machines
betterquesting:10.desc:8:
Congratulations, Engineer!

You've mastered the basics of survival. But this is just the beginning.

The next era introduces MACHINES - devices that process ores, generate power, and automate your world. Copper, Tin, and Rubber await!

⚡ Welcome to the Bronze Age ⚡

Welcome to the Bronze Age, Engineer!

You've noticed strange orange and gray ores while mining. These are Copper and Tin - the foundation of electrical technology.

Copper conducts electricity. Tin strengthens alloys. Together, they make Bronze - stronger than iron for many applications.

Your first task: find these new ores!

Mine copper and tin ore. They spawn at similar levels to iron (Y=0-64), so you've probably already seen them!

Copper - Orange ore, very common
Tin - Gray/white ore, less common

You'll need lots of both. The machines ahead are hungry for metal!

Bronze is made by combining Copper and Tin dust in a 3:1 ratio:

Recipe: 3 Copper Dust + 1 Tin Dust = 4 Bronze Dust

To get dust, you need to crush ingots or ore. For now, use a Forge Hammer (shapeless: 5 iron + 2 sticks) to manually crush ores and ingots into dust.

Later, machines will do this automatically!

Look for tall trees with orange spots on their trunks - these are Rubber Trees!

Craft a Treetap (5 wood planks in a 'Y' shape) and right-click the orange spots to extract Sticky Resin. Each spot can be tapped multiple times.

Pro Tip: Rubber trees spawn in swamps and forests. Their saplings can be replanted!

Smelt the resin into Rubber bars - essential for insulating wires.

Smelt your Sticky Resin in a furnace to get Rubber bars.

1 Sticky Resin -> 1 Rubber (in furnace)

Rubber is used to insulate cables, preventing power loss and keeping you from getting shocked!

Future Tech: An Extractor machine will give you 3 Rubber per Resin instead of 1. Efficiency matters!

Bronze tools are between iron and diamond in durability! They're a great stepping stone while you save diamonds for machines.

Craft bronze tools just like iron tools, but with bronze ingots.

The Bronze Pickaxe can mine anything iron can, and lasts longer!

The Forge Hammer is a manual ore processing tool.

Craft: 5 Iron Ingots + 2 Sticks (shapeless)

Use: Put ore or ingot in crafting grid with hammer = Dust

Dust can be smelted into ingots. When you crush ORE into dust and smelt it, you get the same amount as normal... but soon you'll have a Macerator that doubles your output!

The hammer has durability - it will break eventually.

Time to make your first electrical cables!

Step 1: Craft Copper Cable
- Put a Copper Ingot in a crafting grid (shapeless) = 3 Uninsulated Copper Cable

Step 2: Insulate with Rubber
- Copper Cable + Rubber = Insulated Copper Cable

Insulated cables don't shock you and lose less power over distance. Always insulate your cables!

The Iron Furnace is a stepping stone between vanilla furnaces and electric machines.

Benefits:
- Smelts 20% faster than stone furnace
- Uses same fuel as regular furnace
- Required to craft the Generator!

Recipe: Iron around a Furnace (like making a chest but with a furnace in the middle)

This is it - your first GENERATOR!

The Generator burns fuel (coal, charcoal, wood) and produces EU (Energy Units) - the power that runs IC2 machines.

Output: 10 EU/t (EU per tick)
Fuel: Same as furnace - coal is best

Recipe:
- Top: RE-Battery
- Middle: Iron Furnace
- Bottom: 3 Stone
- Sides: Nothing

Place it down and feed it coal. The gauge shows stored EU!

The RE-Battery stores 10,000 EU and can be charged in a Generator or BatBox.

Recipe:
- 4 Tin Ingots (corners)
- 2 Copper Cable (top/bottom center)
- 2 Redstone (left/right center)
- 1 Tin Ingot (center)

Batteries let you carry power around! Put a charged battery in a Generator to transfer its power out.

Later, better batteries will store much more energy.

The Electronic Circuit is the brain of every IC2 machine!

Recipe:
- 6 Insulated Copper Cable (top and bottom rows)
- 2 Redstone (left and right center)
- 1 Refined Iron Ingot (center)

Getting Refined Iron:
Smelt Iron Ingot in a furnace -> Refined Iron
(Later: Use Compressor for better efficiency)

You'll need LOTS of circuits. Start stockpiling!

The BatBox stores 40,000 EU and helps buffer your power supply.

Why you need it:
- Generators produce power constantly
- Machines draw power in bursts
- BatBox stores excess for when you need it

Recipe:
- 5 Wood Planks (top, sides, bottom corners)
- 3 RE-Batteries (middle row)
- 1 Wood Plank (bottom center)

The dot on the BatBox shows the OUTPUT side - point this toward your machines!

Time to build your first power infrastructure!

Setup:
1. Place Generator
2. Place BatBox next to it (dot facing AWAY from generator)
3. Connect machines to BatBox output with cables
4. Feed coal to Generator
5. Watch the power flow!

Tip: The Generator's dot is the OUTPUT. The BatBox dot is also OUTPUT. Connect input sides to output sides!

You now have a working power grid. Era III awaits!

betterquesting:10.name:8: ERA II COMPLETE: The Industrial Revolution
betterquesting:10.desc:8:
CONGRATULATIONS, ENGINEER!

You've mastered the Bronze Age:
- Discovered copper, tin, and rubber
- Created bronze alloy
- Built your first generator
- Crafted electronic circuits
- Established a power grid

The Industrial Revolution begins NOW.

Era III introduces:
- The MACERATOR (double your ores!)
- Electric Furnace (faster smelting)
- Compressor & Extractor
- Advanced power storage

Your factory empire awaits!

Welcome to the Industrial Age, Engineer!

You've built a generator and learned the basics of EU power. Now it's time to put that power to WORK.

This era introduces:
- Ore Processing - Double your mining output!
- Power Generation - Solar, water, geothermal
- Energy Storage - Store millions of EU
- Advanced Machines - Faster, better, stronger

Three paths await. You can tackle them in any order, but you'll need to master all three to advance.

The Macerator is the most important machine in IC2!

What it does:
Grinds ore into 2 dust -> Smelt dust -> 2 ingots
DOUBLE YOUR ORES!

Recipe:
- 3 Flint (top row)
- 1 Cobblestone, 1 Machine Block, 1 Cobblestone (middle)
- 1 Cobblestone, 1 Circuit, 1 Cobblestone (bottom)

Machine Block: 8 Refined Iron in a square (empty center)

This single machine will transform your resource economy!

Put your Macerator to work!

Process:
1. Place Macerator next to your power (BatBox output)
2. Put ore in the top slot
3. Wait for grinding (watch the progress bar)
4. Collect 2 dust from output
5. Smelt dust in furnace -> 2 ingots!

Challenge: Process enough ore to get 64 iron ingots using your Macerator.

You just saved yourself hours of mining!

Why burn coal when you have ELECTRICITY?

The Electric Furnace smelts items using EU instead of fuel.

Benefits:
- No more coal management
- Connects directly to your power grid
- Faster than iron furnace
- Can be upgraded later!

Recipe:
- 1 Circuit (top center)
- 1 Refined Iron, 1 Iron Furnace, 1 Refined Iron (middle)
- 1 Redstone, 1 Refined Iron, 1 Redstone (bottom)

Pair it with your Macerator: Ore -> Macerator -> E-Furnace -> Ingots!

Remember getting 1 Rubber from 1 Resin in a furnace?

The Extractor gives you 3 Rubber per Resin!

Triple efficiency!

Recipe:
- 4 Tree Taps (corners)
- 1 Machine Block (center)
- 1 Circuit (bottom center)

Other uses:
- Extract rubber from rubber wood
- Process various IC2 materials

Never waste resin in a furnace again!

The Compressor squeezes materials into denser forms.

Key recipes:
- Coal -> Coal Ball -> Compressed Coal -> Coal Chunk -> Diamond!
- Refined Iron -> Dense Iron Plate
- 8 Cobblestone -> Stone
- Snowballs -> Ice
- Carbon Mesh -> Carbon Plate (for advanced items)

Recipe:
- 1 Stone, 1 Machine Block, 1 Stone (top)
- 1 Stone, 1 Circuit, 1 Stone (bottom)

You've now completed your basic ore processing setup!

Burning coal works, but it's not sustainable!

IC2 offers several renewable power options:

- Solar Panel - Free power from sunlight
- Water Mill - Power from water flow
- Geothermal - Massive power from lava

Each has pros and cons. A smart engineer uses multiple sources!

Let's explore your options...

The Solar Panel generates free EU from sunlight!

Output: 1 EU/t during daytime
Requirements: Clear view of sky, daytime, no rain
Lifetime: Infinite (no fuel needed!)

Recipe:
- 3 Coal Dust (top)
- 3 Glass (middle)
- 1 Circuit, 1 Generator, 1 Circuit (bottom)

Pro tip: Place many panels for more power. They're weak individually but scale infinitely!

Later: Environmental Tech solar arrays produce MUCH more power.

Water Mills generate power from flowing water!

Passive Mode: Place adjacent to water source = 0.25 EU/t
Active Mode: Feed water buckets/cells = 2 EU/t

Recipe:
- 2 Sticks (top corners)
- 3 Wood Planks (top center, middle sides)
- 1 Generator (center)

Best setup: Surround with water sources for passive generation, or pump water in for more power.

Good for early game, but you'll need MANY for serious power.

The Geothermal Generator is your mid-game powerhouse!

Input: Lava (buckets or cells)
Output: 20 EU/t (double a coal Generator!)
Per Bucket: 20,000 EU

Recipe:
- 4 Glass (corners)
- 4 Refined Iron (edges)
- 1 Generator (center)

Pro Setup:
1. Build a Pump in the Nether over a lava lake
2. Pipe lava to Overworld using Ender Tanks
3. Feed into Geothermal Generators
4. Enjoy nearly infinite power!

This is THE power source for mid-game.

Let's compare your power options:

Generator | Output | Fuel | Best For
Coal Gen | 10 EU/t | Coal | Early game
Solar | 1 EU/t | None | Free, passive
Water Mill | 0.25-2 EU/t | Water | Passive backup
Geothermal | 20 EU/t | Lava | Main power

Recommendation:
- Early: Coal Generators
- Mid: Geothermal + Nether lava
- Late: Solar arrays (Environmental Tech)
- End: Draconic Evolution

Build at least one Geothermal to proceed!

You already have a BatBox, but it only holds 40,000 EU.

IC2 has a tiered energy storage system:

Tier | Block | Storage | Max EU/t
LV | BatBox | 40,000 | 32
MV | CESU | 300,000 | 128
HV | MFE | 4,000,000 | 512
EV | MFSU | 10,000,000 | 2048

Warning: Sending too much EU/t into a machine will EXPLODE it!
Match your cables and storage to your power tier.

The CESU (Compact Energy Storage Unit) is your MV-tier storage.

Stats:
- Storage: 300,000 EU
- Max Input/Output: 128 EU/t
- Tier: MV (Medium Voltage)

Recipe:
- 5 Bronze Plates (top and sides)
- 3 Advanced RE-Batteries (middle row)
- 1 Bronze Plate (bottom center)

Advanced RE-Battery: Crafted with 4 bronze, 2 gold cable, 2 sulfur dust

The CESU bridges the gap between early-game BatBox and late-game MFE.

The MFE (Medium Frequency Energy) stores serious power!

Stats:
- Storage: 4,000,000 EU (4M!)
- Max Input/Output: 512 EU/t
- Tier: HV (High Voltage)

Recipe:
- 4 Gold Cable (corners)
- 4 Energy Crystals (edges)
- 1 Machine Block (center)

Energy Crystal: 9 Redstone around 1 Diamond

The MFE is your main storage for mid-game. Connect multiple generators to fill it up!

The MFSU (Multi-Functional Storage Unit) is IC2's ultimate storage!

Stats:
- Storage: 10,000,000 EU (10M!)
- Max Input/Output: 2048 EU/t
- Tier: EV (Extreme Voltage)

Recipe:
- 1 Lapotron Crystal (top center)
- 1 Advanced Machine Block, 1 MFE, 1 Advanced Machine Block (middle)
- 1 Advanced Circuit, 1 Advanced Machine Block, 1 Advanced Circuit (bottom)

Lapotron Crystal: 6 Lapis around 1 Energy Crystal and 2 Circuits

One MFSU can power your entire base!

Different cables handle different voltages!

Cable | Max EU/t | Loss | Best For
Copper | 32 | High | LV only
Gold | 128 | Medium | MV
HV | 512 | Low | HV
Glass Fibre | 8192 | Minimal | Everything

Warning: Cable that's too weak will BURN and potentially explode!

Glass Fibre Cable:
- 6 Glass, 2 Silver Dust, 1 Diamond = 4 Cable

Glass Fibre can carry any voltage with almost no loss. Worth the cost!

You've mastered the three pillars of IC2:
- Ore Processing
- Power Generation
- Energy Storage

Now it's time to upgrade your machines!

Advanced machines require Advanced Circuits and Advanced Machine Blocks.

Advanced Circuit:
- 4 Redstone, 2 Glowstone, 2 Lapis
- 1 Electronic Circuit (center)

Stock up - you'll need many of these!

The Advanced Machine Block is the foundation of upgraded machines.

Recipe:
- 2 Carbon Plates (top/bottom center)
- 2 Advanced Alloy (left/right center)
- 1 Machine Block (center)
- 4 Steel Plates (corners)

Advanced Alloy: Iron + Bronze + Tin plates compressed
Carbon Plate: 8 Coal -> Macerator -> Compressor chain

These blocks are expensive but enable much faster machines!

The Induction Furnace is a MASSIVE upgrade!

Features:
- Smelts TWO items at once
- Gets faster as it heats up (up to 4x speed!)
- Heat is maintained while powered

Recipe:
- 1 Advanced Circuit (top center)
- 2 Copper Cable, 1 Advanced Machine Block (middle)
- 1 Copper Cable, 1 Electric Furnace, 1 Copper Cable (bottom)

Pro tip: Keep it running 24/7 - cold startup is slow, but a hot furnace is FAST.

The Rotary Macerator spins up to INSANE speeds!

Features:
- Starts slow, speeds up over time
- At max speed: 4x faster than basic Macerator!
- Maintains spin while powered

Recipe:
- 1 Advanced Circuit (top center)
- 2 Advanced Alloy, 1 Advanced Machine Block (middle)
- 1 Advanced Alloy, 1 Macerator, 1 Advanced Alloy (bottom)

Synergy: Pair with Induction Furnace for blazing fast ore processing!

The Singularity Compressor uses micro black holes!

Features:
- Much faster compression
- Same recipes as basic Compressor
- Essential for mass Carbon Plate production

Recipe:
- 1 Advanced Circuit (top center)
- 2 Advanced Alloy, 1 Advanced Machine Block (middle)
- 1 Advanced Alloy, 1 Compressor, 1 Advanced Alloy (bottom)

Use case: When making lots of Carbon Plates for Advanced Machine Blocks, speed matters!

The Centrifuge Extractor completes your advanced machine set!

Features:
- Spins up like other advanced machines
- Much faster rubber extraction
- Also processes other extractable materials

Recipe:
- 1 Advanced Circuit (top center)
- 2 Advanced Alloy, 1 Advanced Machine Block (middle)
- 1 Advanced Alloy, 1 Extractor, 1 Advanced Alloy (bottom)

With all four advanced processors, your factory is ready for serious automation!

There's one more power source we haven't covered: NUCLEAR!

Nuclear Reactors produce massive EU/t but require careful design to avoid... accidents.

Components:
- Reactor Chamber (expands capacity)
- Uranium Cells (fuel)
- Coolant Cells (prevent meltdown)
- Heat Vents (dissipate heat)

Warning: A poorly designed reactor WILL explode and irradiate the area!

For now, just craft a Reactor Chamber to prove you understand the basics. Full nuclear engineering comes in Era IV!

betterquesting:10.name:8: ERA III COMPLETE: The Age of Automation
betterquesting:10.desc:8:
CONGRATULATIONS, MASTER ENGINEER!

You've conquered the Industrial Age:

- Mastered ore processing (Macerator -> 2x ores!)
- Harnessed renewable energy (Solar, Geothermal)
- Built EU storage infrastructure (MFE/MFSU)
- Upgraded to advanced machines
- Previewed nuclear power

But your factory still requires manual work. Time to change that!

Era IV: Automation Age
BuildCraft pipes, engines, and the legendary QUARRY await. Your machines will run themselves while you focus on bigger projects.

Welcome to TRUE automation!

Master Engineer!

Your IC2 factory hums with power, but every item still needs your hands. It's time to change that.

BuildCraft introduces PIPES - the arteries of automation. Items flow, fluids pump, power transmits... all without you lifting a finger.

By the end of this era, machines will feed machines, and you'll unlock the legendary QUARRY - a device that mines entire chunks automatically!

Welcome to the Automation Age.

BuildCraft machines need GEARS - mechanical components that transfer rotational force.

The gear progression:
- Wood Gear - 4 sticks in a cross
- Stone Gear - 4 cobble around a wood gear
- Iron Gear - 4 iron around a stone gear
- Gold Gear - 4 gold around an iron gear
- Diamond Gear - 4 diamond around a gold gear

Start simple. Craft the foundation of all BuildCraft machines!

Engines convert fuel into MJ (Minecraft Joules) - BuildCraft's power unit.

The Stirling Engine burns solid fuels (coal, wood) and produces steady power.

IMPORTANT: Engines need a redstone signal to run! Place a lever next to it and flip it ON.

Tip: Engines can overheat if not outputting power. Always connect them to something that uses power!

Recipe: 3 Cobble, 1 Glass, 1 Iron Gear, 2 Stone, 1 Piston

The Wooden Pipe is special - it EXTRACTS items from inventories.

How it works:
1. Place wooden pipe against a chest/machine
2. Connect an engine to the wooden pipe
3. Power the engine with redstone
4. Items get pulled out!

Wooden pipes don't connect to each other - they're extraction only.

Recipe: Wood Plank + Glass + Wood Plank (shapeless)

Transport pipes carry items from A to B.

Cobblestone Pipe - Cheap but connects to everything
Stone Pipe - Won't connect to cobblestone (useful for routing!)
Gold Pipe - Speeds up items passing through

Pro Tips:
- Items that reach a dead end get ejected into the world
- Always have a destination chest at the end of your network
- Use stone/cobble mismatch to prevent unwanted connections

The Iron Pipe only outputs in ONE direction!

Right-click to change the output direction. Use this to:
- Split lines without items going backward
- Create one-way systems
- Direct items to specific machines

Combine with redstone to switch directions automatically!

The Diamond Pipe is the brain of your item network!

Right-click to open the GUI and assign items to colors. Items matching a filter go that direction.

Example:
- North (Black): Iron Ore to Macerator
- South (White): Iron Dust to Furnace
- West (Red): Iron Ingots to Storage

Unfiltered items take the default (no color) direction.

This single pipe enables full factory automation!

Fluid pipes work like item pipes but for liquids!

Wooden Fluid Pipe - Extracts from tanks/machines
Cobblestone/Stone Fluid Pipe - Transport
Gold Fluid Pipe - Faster flow
Iron Fluid Pipe - One-way flow

Perfect for:
- Pumping lava to Geothermal Generators
- Moving water for farming
- Oil processing systems

BuildCraft Tanks store 16 buckets of any fluid.

Stack them vertically to increase capacity - they auto-connect!

Recipe: 8 Glass in a ring

Use for:
- Lava buffer for Geothermals
- Water storage for farms
- Oil/Fuel storage for refineries

Pro tip: Place tanks adjacent horizontally and they stay separate - useful for multiple fluid types!

The Pump extracts fluids from the world!

Place it above a liquid and power it with an engine. It will:
- Drain lakes (water, oil)
- Pull lava from the Nether
- Work through any depth

Pro Setup: Pump + Fluid Pipes + Ender Tank = Nether lava to Overworld!

Recipe: 1 Tank, 2 Iron Gear, 1 Mining Well, 4 Iron Ingot

Kinesis Pipes transport MJ power!

Wooden Kinesis Pipe - Extracts from engines
Cobblestone Kinesis - 80 MJ/t max
Stone Kinesis - 160 MJ/t
Gold Kinesis - 1280 MJ/t
Diamond Kinesis - 10240 MJ/t

Power is lost over distance! Keep engines close to machines, or use better pipes.

Always start with a Wooden Kinesis Pipe attached to your engine!

You have IC2 EU power and need BuildCraft MJ power. Solution: Energy Converters!

The Energy Bridge is the hub. Attach:
- EU Consumer - Accepts IC2 EU
- MJ Producer - Outputs BuildCraft MJ

Conversion: 2.5 EU = 1 MJ (approximately)

Now your IC2 power infrastructure can run BuildCraft machines without separate engines!

Recipe: Check JEI for Energy Converters mod recipes

The Combustion Engine is BuildCraft's powerhouse!

Fuel: Oil (slow) or Fuel (fast)
Coolant: Water (required!)
Output: 30-60 MJ/t

DANGER: Without coolant, combustion engines EXPLODE!

Setup:
1. Pipe water into the engine constantly
2. Pipe oil/fuel into the engine
3. Connect to machine via kinesis pipe
4. Activate with redstone

One combustion engine can power a Quarry!

Time to connect the dots!

Build an automated ore processing line:
1. Chest (input) -> Wooden Pipe -> Diamond Pipe
2. Diamond Pipe sorts: Ore to Macerator, Dust to Furnace
3. Macerator -> Pipe -> back to Diamond Pipe (dust out)
4. Furnace -> Pipe -> Output Chest

One setup processes ALL your ores automatically!

Bonus: Use Induction Furnace for 2x speed.

Build a self-sustaining lava power station!

Setup:
1. Pump in Nether (above lava lake)
2. Fluid pipes to Ender Tank (or long pipe run)
3. Ender Tank in Overworld
4. Fluid pipes to multiple Geothermal Generators
5. Geothermals feed into MFSU

Result: Infinite power from Nether lava!

Pro tip: One pump can supply 4-6 Geothermals.

The Mining Well is the Quarry's little brother.

It drills a single column straight down to bedrock, replacing stone with Mining Pipe.

Useful for:
- Quick vertical shafts
- Testing power setups
- Crafting ingredient for Pump

Recipe: 3 Iron, 3 Iron Gear, 2 Stone Gear, 1 Redstone

THE QUARRY - the most iconic BuildCraft machine!

What it does:
- Mines a configurable area (default 9x9, max 64x64)
- Digs from surface to bedrock
- Outputs items via pipes or adjacent inventory

Recipe:
- 2 Diamond Gear (corners)
- 2 Gold Gear (corners)
- 3 Iron Gear (bottom)
- 2 Diamond Pickaxe (sides)
- 1 Redstone (center)

Power: Needs ~15-30 MJ/t for good speed. Use Combustion Engine or EU->MJ converter.

This. Changes. Everything.

Your Quarry is built. Now optimize it!

Setup Checklist:
- Power source (Combustion Engine / EU converter)
- Landmark poles for custom area (optional)
- Chest or pipe on Quarry for item output
- Pipe network to sorting system
- Void pipe or overflow for cobblestone/dirt

Pro Tips:
- Use Diamond Pipe to sort ores from junk
- 4 Stirling Engines = slow but works
- 1 Combustion Engine = good speed
- EU->MJ from MFSU = best efficiency

Run your Quarry overnight. Wake up to thousands of ores!

betterquesting:10.name:8: ERA IV COMPLETE: Master of Automation
betterquesting:10.desc:8:
AUTOMATION MASTER!

You've achieved what few engineers dream of:

- Built self-running factories
- Mastered pipe logistics
- Connected IC2 and BuildCraft power
- Deployed automated mining

Your machines work while you sleep. Resources flow like water. The foundation is complete.

But there's more...

Era V introduces NUCLEAR POWER - reactors, uranium processing, and incredible energy output for end-game tech.

Or explore ProjectE and turn dirt into diamonds?

The choice is yours, Engineer.

Engineer, you've mastered automation. Now it's time for REAL power.

Nuclear reactors produce enormous EU - enough to power entire bases from a single block. But they demand respect.

§c⚠️ WARNING:§r Improperly designed reactors WILL:
- Overheat and melt down
- Explode (bigger than TNT!)
- Irradiate the surrounding area

This era will teach you to harness the atom safely. Pay attention to the lessons - your base depends on it.

Are you ready to split atoms?

Uranium Ore spawns rarely below Y=64. It looks like green-tinted stone.

§c⚠️ RADIATION WARNING:§r
- Standing near uranium ore causes minor radiation
- Carrying uranium items causes radiation damage
- Use a Hazmat Suit for protection!

Mining Tips:
- Macerator gives 2 Crushed Uranium per ore
- Fortune pickaxe works on uranium ore
- Check caves around Y=20 for best results

Gather uranium carefully - you'll need plenty for fuel rods.

Raw uranium must be processed into fuel rods.

§6Processing Chain:§r
1. Uranium Ore → Macerator → Crushed Uranium
2. Crushed Uranium → Thermal Centrifuge → U-235 + U-238
3. U-238 (6) + U-235 (3) → Enriched Uranium Fuel
4. Enriched Fuel + Iron Plate → Uranium Fuel Rod

§6Fuel Rod Types:§r
- §aSingle:§r Basic, easy to cool
- §eDual:§r 2x power, 2x heat
- §cQuad:§r 4x power, 4x heat, HARD to cool!

Start with single rods while learning.

The §6Thermal Centrifuge§r is essential for nuclear fuel processing.

What it does:
- Separates Crushed Uranium into U-235 (enriched) and U-238 (depleted)
- Processes spent fuel cells for re-enrichment
- Works at 48 EU/t (MV tier)

Recipe:
- 2 Motor
- 2 Coil
- 1 Machine Casing
- 4 Advanced Alloy

Pro tip: Process ALL crushed uranium - both isotopes are valuable!

Reactor heat will §cKILL§r your reactor if not managed!

§6Heat Sources:§r
- Fuel rods generate heat every tick
- Adjacent fuel rods multiply heat output
- No cooling = temperature rises

§6Heat Dissipation:§r
- §aHeat Vents§r - Dissipate heat to air
- §bHeat Exchangers§r - Move heat between components
- §9Coolant Cells§r - Store heat temporarily
- §7Plating§r - Increases max hull heat capacity

§cThe Rule:§r Heat dissipated ≥ Heat generated = Safe reactor

Start with basic Heat Vents - they're the foundation of all cooling.

Different cooling components for different situations:

§6Heat Vents:§r
- Basic Vent: 6 heat/t self-cooling
- Reactor Vent: 5 heat/t from hull
- Overclocked Vent: 20 heat/t but needs incoming heat
- Component Vent: 4 heat/t from adjacent

§6Heat Exchangers:§r
- Move heat between components
- Reactor Exchanger: Hull ↔ Component
- Component Exchanger: Between adjacents
- Advanced Exchanger: 24 heat/t transfer

§aPro Strategy:§r Use exchangers to move heat TO vents.

Craft a variety - you'll need them for efficient designs.

Time to build your first nuclear reactor!

§6Basic Reactor Recipe:§r
- 3 Reactor Chambers (optional, expand grid)
- 4 Dense Lead Plates
- 1 Generator
- 1 Advanced Machine Casing

§aSAFE STARTER DESIGN (3x3 grid):§r
[V] [U] [V]
[V] [V] [V]
[V] [U] [V]
V = Heat Vent, U = Single Uranium Rod

This produces ~20 EU/t safely. Not efficient, but it §aWON'T explode!§r

Place the reactor, insert components via GUI, and watch the EU flow.

Your reactor is built. Now learn to operate it!

§6Monitoring:§r
- Right-click reactor to open GUI
- Reactor shows hull heat (keep below max!)
- Components show individual heat
- EU output shown on side displays

§6Safety Checklist:§r
☐ Heat vents outnumber fuel rods
☐ Hull heat stays below 50%
☐ EU is being extracted (full buffer = heat buildup)
☐ MFSU or cable connected to reactor

§cIf Heat Rises:§r
1. Remove fuel rods IMMEDIATELY
2. Let heat vent down
3. Redesign with more cooling

Run your reactor for 1 full fuel cycle to complete this quest.

§6Reactor Chambers§r expand your reactor grid!

Base reactor: 3x6 = 18 slots
With 6 chambers: 9x6 = §a54 slots!§r

Placement:
- Chambers must touch the reactor directly
- Up to 6 chambers (one per face)
- Each adds 1 column to the grid

More slots = more fuel + more cooling = more power!

Recipe:
- 4 Machine Casing
- 4 Dense Lead Plates

Build your full 6-chamber reactor for maximum capacity.

Time to optimize! A §6Mark II reactor§r runs continuously at stable heat.

§aEFFICIENT DESIGN (6 chambers, ~100 EU/t):§r
Row 1: [OV][U ][CV][CV][U ][OV]
Row 2: [HE][CV][OV][OV][CV][HE]
Row 3: [OV][U ][CV][CV][U ][OV]
Row 4: [HE][CV][OV][OV][CV][HE]
Row 5: [OV][U ][CV][CV][U ][OV]

OV=Overclocked Vent, CV=Component Vent
HE=Heat Exchanger, U=Single Uranium

This balances heat generation with dissipation perfectly!

Goal: Run 100 EU/t continuously.

§6Neutron Reflectors§r boost fuel rod output!

How they work:
- Place adjacent to fuel rods
- Reflects neutrons back into fuel
- Increases EU output significantly
- Adds §aNO heat generation!§r

Types:
- Basic Reflector: 30k durability
- Thick Reflector: 120k durability
- Iridium Reflector: §dINFINITE§r durability

§aPro Design Tip:§r
Surround each fuel rod with reflectors on sides that don't have cooling.

Reflectors are the key to efficient high-output designs!

§6Quad Fuel Rods§r are the ultimate power source!

4x the uranium = 4x the EU output
§cBUT ALSO:§r 4x the heat generation!

Quad rods are for §cEXPERTS ONLY:§r
- Require massive cooling infrastructure
- One quad rod can overwhelm basic setups
- But efficiently cooled = incredible EU/t

§6Recipe:§r 4 Single Rods + 3 Copper Plates + 1 Dense Copper Plate

§cDon't put this in your reactor until you've mastered cooling!§r

§6MOX Fuel§r (Mixed Oxide) is advanced nuclear fuel!

§aUnique Property:§r
- EU output §aINCREASES§r with reactor heat
- At 50% hull heat: ~1.5x output
- At 84% hull heat: §d5x output!§r

§c⚠️ EXTREME DANGER:§r
MOX reactors run HOT deliberately. One mistake = meltdown.

Recipe:
- Plutonium (from reprocessed uranium)
- Similar to regular fuel rods

MOX is for players who want §dMAXIMUM§r power and can handle the risk.

Depleted uranium cells aren't waste - they're resources!

§6Reprocessing Chain:§r
1. Depleted Cell → Thermal Centrifuge → Plutonium + U-238
2. Plutonium → MOX Fuel Rods
3. U-238 → Re-enrichment or Breeder reactors

§aSustainable Nuclear:§r
- Run uranium reactor
- Reprocess depleted cells
- Make MOX from plutonium
- Breed more U-235 from U-238

A well-designed nuclear program is nearly §aself-sustaining!§r

§6Reactor Plating§r increases hull heat capacity!

Why it matters:
- Base hull: 10,000 heat capacity
- Each plating: +1000 capacity
- Heat-Capacity Plating: +2000 capacity

More capacity = more buffer before meltdown!

§6Containment Plating:§r
- Reduces explosion radius if meltdown occurs
- Won't prevent meltdown, just limits damage
- Use as insurance, not primary defense

Plating lets you run hotter reactors safely.

Automate reactor safety with redstone control!

§6Reactor Redstone Port:§r
- Attach to reactor chamber
- Configure in GUI for various signals
- Can output: heat level, EU output status
- Can input: enable/disable reactor

§aSafety Setup:§r
1. Redstone Port set to output at 75% heat
2. Connect to NOT gate
3. Feed back to reactor enable
4. Reactor auto-shuts at high heat!

§aPro Tip:§r Use ComputerCraft for advanced monitoring (if installed).

§6Breeder Reactors§r create MORE fuel than they consume!

How breeding works:
- Neutrons from fuel rods hit U-238 cells
- U-238 gradually enriches
- Eventually becomes re-enriched uranium fuel!

§aBreeder Design Principles:§r
- Run at HIGH heat (increases breeding speed)
- Surround fuel rods with U-238 cells
- Use isotope cells, not empty cells
- Be patient - breeding takes time

A breeder + standard reactor = §ainfinite fuel!§r

You've learned the full nuclear fuel cycle!

§6Complete Nuclear Setup:§r

1. §eMining:§r Uranium ore → Macerator → Crushed
2. §eSeparation:§r Thermal Centrifuge → U-235 + U-238
3. §ePower Reactor:§r U-235 fuel rods → EU + Depleted cells
4. §eReprocessing:§r Depleted → Plutonium + U-238
5. §eBreeder:§r U-238 + neutrons → Re-enriched fuel
6. §eMOX Production:§r Plutonium → MOX rods for heat-boosted power

You now command the atom. Use this power wisely!

Produce depleted cells and plutonium to prove your mastery.

§6NUCLEAR ENGINEER!§r

You have conquered the atom:

☢️ Mined and processed uranium
☢️ Built safe reactor designs
☢️ Mastered heat management
☢️ Explored MOX and breeder systems
☢️ Achieved sustainable nuclear power

Your base now has virtually unlimited EU. Millions of energy units flow at your command.

But there's always more power to harness...

§dEra VI introduces DRACONIC EVOLUTION§r - technology so advanced it borders on magic. Energy cores the size of buildings. Armor that makes you invincible. Tools that reshape the world.

Or perhaps transmutation calls to you? §aProjectE§r awaits...

The universe is yours, Engineer.
Welcome to EnergyCraft! This chapter will teach you the basics of survival and introduce you to the quest system. Complete all quests to unlock the Age of Machines.
The age of metal begins! Discover copper and tin, learn to alloy bronze, and take your first steps into electrical engineering. Master these fundamentals and you'll be ready for true industry.

The age of machines! Master ore processing with the Macerator, harness renewable energy from the sun and lava, and build advanced machines that process materials at incredible speeds. Three paths await: Ore Processing, Power Generation, and Energy Storage. Master all three to unlock the full potential of industry.

Master BuildCraft automation! Learn the art of pipes - moving items, fluids, and power without lifting a finger. Three branches await: Item Pipes for logistics, Fluid Pipes for liquids, and Kinesis Pipes for power. Converge your knowledge to build automated factories and finally unlock the legendary QUARRY - automated mining at its finest!

Harness the power of the atom! Learn uranium processing, build nuclear reactors, master heat management, and achieve sustainable nuclear power. Three branches await: Efficiency designs, Advanced Fuel (MOX), and Safety systems. Handle with care - great power requires great responsibility.
